        public Terrain get(java.awt.geom.Point2D pos)

        Returns:
        terrain at the specified position

      • isCollision

        public boolean isCollision(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
                  java.awt.geom.Point2D p2)
        Collisions in PacMan are determined when two points tiles are equal. Simply perform an equivalence check on the tiles of each point and return the resulting value.
        Parameters:
        p1 -
        p2 -
        Returns:
        whether or not the points collide

      • isCollision

        public boolean isCollision(Actor a1,
                  Actor a2)

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if there are still food and energizer terrain remaining in the grid and false otherwise. This method is used to determine if the player has won.
        Returns:
        whether or not there is food/energizers remaining

      • wrap

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D wrap(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Performs wrap around on the given tile. This method prevents OutOfBoundsExceptions and enables the use of the teleportation tunnel.
        Parameters:
        point -
        Returns:

      • snap

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D snap(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Performs a snap to grid on the specified point. First, it translates the point into a tile coordinate, and then it determines and returns the center point of the specified tile.
        Parameters:
        point -
        Returns:
        center point of current tile

      • snap

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D snap(java.awt.Point tile)

      • adjacent

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D adjacent(java.awt.geom.Point2D src,
                             Actor.Orientation dir,
                             double dist)
        Returns the center Point2D of the tile in the specified direction that is dist tiles away. This is used in the targeting mechanisms for the various types of ghosts.
        Parameters:
        src -
        dir -
        Returns:
        center Point2D of the tile in the adjacent direction

      • adjacent

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D adjacent(Actor actor,
                             double dist)

      • load

        public static Grid load(java.lang.String map,
        int width,
        int height)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a PacMap from a text file. The format for a PacMap file is defined as a text file (.txt) in which each character represents the ordinal of the desired terrain in the Terrain enum. The file must begin with two numbers that specify the width and height of the PacMap.
        Parameters:
        file - file to load from
        tileSize - size of each tile in pixels
        Returns:
        PacMap representation of the file's contents
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the file cannot be read
